intro: Glottiphyllum uncatum, commonly known as the naked leafed spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that lack stipules. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
